Azerbaijan's relations with all Caspian littoral states are very close, mutually beneficial and friendly partnerships.
Our today's accomplishments, the agreements we have concluded are the result of a very serious, sincere work.
We have made decisions that can be considered as an important step forward in some areas.
These decisions make us more confident that we will solve all issues related to our mutual cooperation in the Caspian Sea.
Considering the level of mutual trust and trust between our countries, each Caspian littoral country, (cont) http://t.co/K20eQykjYW
Determined in bilateral and trilateral agreements on division of coastal areas of the Caspian Sea (cont) http://t.co/Is9ng1sPBy
We confirm our adherence to the agreement reached at the Baku Summit, and the coastal state (cont) http://t.co/D0kqX8CV4R
The middle line, known as the basic norm in the division of coastal areas of the seabed, is http://t.co/DSX6VJiORU
We consider the Caspian Sea a sea of ​​friendship, peace, security and cooperation.
Azerbaijan pays special attention to the development of bilateral relations based on mutual respect and trust with the Caspian littoral states.
Close friendly relations and multi-vector cooperation between the Caspian littoral states in our region, (cont) http://t.co/4a5OiZQDc4
The Caspian Sea is a coordinating element in a number of international and regional projects for the development of transport corridors.
Azerbaijan attaches great importance to cooperation with its neighbors in the oil and gas field in the Caspian Sea.
Armenia's aggression against Azerbaijan is a major threat to regional security.
This conflict should be resolved on the basis of internationally recognized norms and recognized territorial integrity of Azerbaijan.
The Armenian regime is directly responsible for possible consequences of this conflict.

"American leadership is the one constant in an uncertain world." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"As Americans, we can and should be proud of the progress our country has made over these past six years." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"Today, our businesses are hiring 200,000 Americans per month." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"This is the longest, uninterrupted stretch of job growth in our history." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"When the middle class thrives ... America thrives. When it doesn’t, America doesn't." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
The highest congratulations and congratulations by Eid Al Adha. I ask Allah Almighty to protect you and your loved ones and to preserve our most precious land of security and stability.
"We have to make our economy work for every working American." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"Today, they’re building and selling new cars at the fastest rate in eight years." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"Last year, our elementary and middle school students had the highest math and reading scores on record." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"In the decade before the Affordable Care Act—AKA Obamacare—double-digit premium increases were common." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"Today, we have seen a dramatic slowdown in the rising cost of health care." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"Premiums are rising at a rate tied for the lowest on record." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"We're slowing the cost of health care—and we're covering more people at the same time." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"When I took office, the deficit was nearly 10 percent of our economy. Today, it’s approaching 3 percent." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"America is better poised to lead and succeed in the 21st century than any other nation on Earth." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"I’m setting a new goal: By the end of this decade, let’s enroll six million children in high-quality preschool." —President Obama
"Let's keep reforming our education system so young people at every level have the same shot at success." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"If we raise the minimum wage, we won’t just put more money in workers’ pockets—they’ll spend that money." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"Let's agree that no one who works full time in America should ever have to work in poverty." —President Obama
"Let's catch up to 2014." —President Obama on #EqualPay for women
President Obama: While affordable health care might still be a threat to freedom on Fox News, it’s working pretty well in the real world.
"America’s economic greatness has never trickled from the top down—it grows from a rising, thriving middle class." —President Obama
"It is the American people who have made the progress of the last six years possible." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
"The story of America is a story of progress." —President Obama #AmericaLeads
